<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An interface for accessing data in a stream-like format, but which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// discourages copying.  Instead of specifying a buffer in which to copy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// data on a read, the API returns an ArrayRef to data owned by the stream&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// implementation.  Since implementations may not necessarily store data in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// single contiguous buffer (or even in memory at all), in such cases a it may</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be necessary for an implementation to cache such a buffer so that it can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// return it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A BinaryStream which can be read from as well as written to.  Note</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that writing to a BinaryStream always necessitates copying from the input</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buffer to the stream&#39;s backing store.  Streams are assumed to be buffered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// so that to be portable it is necessary to call commit() on the stream when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// all data has been written.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablebinarystream"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablebinarystream">WritableBinaryStream</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// offset. This will always necessitate a copy.  Cannot shrink or grow the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stream, only writes into existing allocated space.</span></CodeLine>
